## **1.0 Getting Started**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, tmap, tidyverse)
```
:::


## 2.0 Importing the data into R

[Master Plan 2014 Subzone Boundary (Web) (SHP)](https://beta.data.gov.sg/datasets/d_d14da225fccf921049ab64238ff473d9/view)\
[Master Plan 2014 Subzone Boundary (Web) (KML)](https://beta.data.gov.sg/datasets/d_5cb80a95445f236737f6bc2bfe5f159d/view)

Import Master Plan 2014 Subzone Boundary (Web) Shapefile


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz <- st_read(dsn = "data/", 
                layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\SMU\Y4S1\IS415\IS415\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21
```


:::
:::


Write Master Plan 2014 Subzone Boundary (Web) Shapefile into KML format as the one provided is corrupted


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
st_write(mpsz,"data/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml", delete_dsn = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Deleting source `data/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' to data source 
  `data/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' using driver `KML'
Writing 323 features with 15 fields and geometry type Multi Polygon.
```


:::
:::


Import newly created KML file


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mp_kml_14 = st_read("data/MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\SMU\Y4S1\IS415\IS415\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data\MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


Import Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary (Web) ShapeFile


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz19 <- st_read(dsn = "data/", 
                layer = "MPSZ-2019") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `C:\SMU\Y4S1\IS415\IS415\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


Import Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary (Web) KML


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mp_kml_19 = st_read("data/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `URA_MP19_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source 
  `C:\SMU\Y4S1\IS415\IS415\In-class_Ex\In-class_Ex02\data\MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml' 
  using driver `KML'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 2 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY, XYZ
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
z_range:       zmin: 0 zmax: 0
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::


Import Population CSV file


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata <- read_csv("data/respopagesextod2023.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 100928 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (5): PA, SZ, AG, Sex, TOD
dbl (2): Pop, Time

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::


## 3.0 Data Wrangling


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata %>%
  group_by(PA, SZ, AG) %>%
  summarise(`POP` = sum(`Pop`)) %>%
  ungroup()%>%
  pivot_wider(names_from=AG, 
              values_from=POP)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'PA', 'SZ'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
colnames(popdata2023)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
 [1] "PA"          "SZ"          "0_to_4"      "10_to_14"    "15_to_19"   
 [6] "20_to_24"    "25_to_29"    "30_to_34"    "35_to_39"    "40_to_44"   
[11] "45_to_49"    "50_to_54"    "55_to_59"    "5_to_9"      "60_to_64"   
[16] "65_to_69"    "70_to_74"    "75_to_79"    "80_to_84"    "85_to_89"   
[21] "90_and_Over"
```


:::
:::


Data Processing


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate(YOUNG = rowSums(.[3:6])
         +rowSums(.[14])) %>%
  mutate(`ECONOMY ACTIVE` = rowSums(.[7:13])+
  rowSums(.[15]))%>%
  mutate(`AGED`=rowSums(.[16:21])) %>%
  mutate(`TOTAL`=rowSums(.[3:21])) %>%  
  mutate(`DEPENDENCY` = (`YOUNG` + `AGED`)
  /`ECONOMY ACTIVE`) %>%
    select(`PA`, `SZ`, `YOUNG`, 
         `ECONOMY ACTIVE`, `AGED`, 
         `TOTAL`, `DEPENDENCY`)
```
:::


Join popdata2023 and mpsz_19


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
popdata2023 <- popdata2023 %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = vars(PA, SZ), 
          .funs = list(toupper))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mpsz_pop2023 <- left_join(mpsz19, popdata2023,
                          by = c("SUBZONE_N" = "SZ"))
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pop2023_mpsz <- left_join(popdata2023, mpsz19,
                          by = c("SZ" = "SUBZONE_N"))
```
:::
